title: Moving charges - force on proton and electron

content.prompt: A proton moves with a constant speed to the right as it enters a region containing a magnetic field directed into the page, as shown. If the proton is replaced with an electron moving at the same speed in the same direction as the proton, which of the following statements best describes the force experienced by the electron due to the magnetic field when compared to the force experienced by the proton?

choices.label: The force on the electron will have the same magnitude and direction as the force experienced by the proton.
The force on the electron will have the same magnitude and opposite direction as the force experienced by the proton.
The force on the electron will be in the same direction as the force experienced by the proton and have a smaller magnitude.
The force on the electron will be in the opposite direction as the force experienced by the proton and have a smaller magnitude.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
